page.title: 17Adult Recreation-Sighthill
page.content: A survey of how people spent their leisure time was conducted on 24th May 1985.The more passive pursuits were the most popular.Watching television and videos,reading and computers were conclusive favourites with many asked. Included in the list of places visited were Bingo halls,theatres,clubs,pubs, hotels,cinemas and football grounds. Most of these were visited regularly. Of the people questioned few took part in sport,although some played,in order of popularity,bowls,football,jogging, tennis,and swimming. The Dockland Community Centre,which is in the area,was used by very few of those involved.Facilities are provided at the Centre for badminton,indoor football,basket-ball,abseiling,pool and computer games.Visitors can get a cup of tea or light refreshment.
